resources.string: "Your and other people’s health matters. That is why some countries and places ask for a coronavirus pass. You’re only allowed to enter carrying this pass."

You can generate a coronavirus pass if:
  • You have been vaccinated
  • A test result confirms you don’t have corona.
  • A test result confirms you\'ve had coronavirus and are recovered.

This app generates a QR code with your vaccination, test result or recovery. That is your certificate. This QR code will be checked at the entrance of places or activities or at the border. If your certificate expires, the QR code disappears from the app.
QR codes for the Netherlands and international
"This app generates a QR code for the Netherlands and one for other countries. You can find both QR codes in the app. Travelling outside of the Netherlands? Then use your international QR code."
This is how the app uses your data
The privacy statement details how CoronaCheck handles your data. These are the most important points:
Your data is not centrally stored anywhere
No location data is used or saved
I have read the privacy statement and understand how CoronaCheck processes my data.
Show both your QR code and your proof of identity at the entrance of the location you\'re visiting.
Travelling outside the Netherlands? Then use your international QR code. In this overview, you\'ll find if the QR code is valid in the country you’re planning to visit.
You can create a QR-code if you\'re vaccinated, if you\'ve had corona or by taking a test at an affiliated test location.
It might be too busy. Please try again later.
Show QR code at the entrance
Want to make a QR code? Get tested for coronavirus first.
Turn your vaccination, negative test result or recovery into a QR code.
Does the test prove you don\'t have coronavirus? Then you can make a QR code out of the test result. Indicate where you were tested.
You need a retrieval code to retrieve your test result.
The test location gives you a retrieval code with numbers and letters.<br\><br\>Didn\'t get a code? Or did you lose it? Contact the test location.<br\><br\>
Enter your code. The test location sent it to you.
You get a code via text or email
This QR code isn\'t valid. Scan the QR code given to you by the test location.
Point your phone at the QR code the test location gave you.
This test result is retrieved from the test location.<br\><br\>Is the below correct? Then you can convert the negative test result into a QR code. This is your test certificate.
Are you sure you want to stop?
You can try to retrieve your test result again later

Your test result states your test result, the time of testing, and a minimum amount of personal data.<br\><br\>Your details consist of: (1) the first letter of your first name, (2) the first letter of your last name, (3) your day of birth and (4) your month of birth.
Are these details different than the details on your identification card? Contact your test location. They can edit your details.
Your test result not yet known. Please try again later. Is this not correct? Contact the test location.
Your test result is now being made into a QR code
That you tested negative (no coronavirus) on February 2 at 14:06 will be processed into the QR code. The CoronaCheck app only shows the anonymous QR code, without test details.

Please try again later.

If you have any questions, contact your test location.

CoronaCheck is created to reopen society step by step. This way, the Netherlands can head out more often and travel abroad.

CoronaCheck creates a coronavirus pass from your vaccination, your negative test result or if you\'ve had corona and are recovered. A coronavirus pass consists of two QR-codes: one for the Netherlands and one for other countries (the EU Digital COVID Certificate).
Your test result has already been retrieved. And it\'s already been made into a QR code.<br\><br\> Is this not correct? Contact the test location.
Your QR code has expired.<br\>Get tested again.

You must get tested before you make a QR code. You can only turn a negative test result into a QR code.<br\><br\>A negative test certificate is valid until %1$s hour(s) after the moment you\'ve been tested. So schedule your test on time. And make sure your QR code is scanned at the entrance within %1$s hour(s).
CoronaCheck wants to access your camera
This is the only way the app can scan your QR code.
The app is no longer in use. For more information, go to CoronaCheck.nl
To continue, install the latest version of the app.
This may be because your internet connection is failing or because the server cannot be reached.
Show QR code at the entrance
You can only use test results no older than %1$s hour(s) to make a QR code.
You can only use test results no older than %1$s hour(s) to make a QR code.
Your test result has been made into a QR code
That you\'ve been tested negative (no coronavirus) on %1$s at %2$s has been processed into the QR code. This app only shows the anonymous QR code, without any further test information.
This is where you can find an image of your QR code.
Information about your negative test result
The server isn’t responding. This may be because your internet connection is failing or because the server cannot be reached.

Vaccination certificateHave you been vaccinated? You can now retrieve your vaccination certificate in the app. And make a QR code of it. This gives you access to certain locations or activities. You\'ll also get a QR code to travel internationally.
You can\'t proceed if you don\'t agree
You can\'t access the CoronaCheck app without agreeing to the updated terms.
The test location sends you a verification code via text or e-mail. Didn\'t get one? Then you can request a new code.
Enter your verification code to retrieve your negative test result.
Beware: your device is rooted. Your data may not be secure.

The app makes a QR code in three steps. This QR code is your personal certificate.

1. Choose the type of certificate
Choose to create a vaccination certificate, a test certificate or a recovery certificate.

2. Automatically retrieve data 
The app directly retrieves the data of your vaccination, test result or recovery.

  3. QR codes are ready 
The app generates a QR code for the Netherlands and one for other countries.
What kind of certificate would you like to add?
Indicate what kind of certificate you would like to add. You can have multiple certificates.
The test proves I do not have coronavirus
I\'ve had my injection or injections

Got vaccinated? Log in with DigiD. Details regarding your vaccination will be retrieved automatically. You only need one injection to make an international QR-code. For a Dutch QR code you need to be fully vaccinated.

Didn\'t get an injection yet? Get vaccinated first.
You can make a QR code of your vaccination. That is your certificate.
Are you sure you want to stop?
You can try to retrieve your vaccination certificate again later
Always use your Dutch QR code within the Netherlands. Travelling outside the Netherlands? Then use your international QR code.
The Dutch QR code only contains your initials, your birth month, and your day of birth.
The international QR code contains the following details: your name, date of birth, and information about the vaccine.
Is your name or date of birth wrong? Look here for more information.

Your Dutch QR code contains minimal data. The QR code doesn\'t say whether or not you have a test certificate or vaccination. It does say whether or not the QR code is valid. The QR code also contains several of your details. This is for verification purposes, to make sure this QR code belongs to you. The details consist of the first letter of your first name, the first letter of your last name, your birth month, and your day of birth. For security reasons, some details may disappear.

Your details: %1$s

Always use the Dutch QR code within the Netherlands. The international QR code isn\'t valid in the Netherlands.

Travelling outside of the Netherlands? Then more data is required. That\'s why the international QR code contains the following details:

Name: %1$s
Date of birth: %2$s

Pathogen: %3$s
Vaccine: %4$s
Vaccine type: %5$s
Manufacturer: %6$s
Doses: %7$s
Date of injection: %8$s
Vaccinated in: %9$s
Unique certificate identifier: %10$s

Always use the international QR code in other countries. The Dutch QR code is not valid outside of the Netherlands.

Travelling outside the Netherlands? This requires more data. That\'s why the international QR code contains the following details:

Name: %1$s
Date of birth: %2$s

Pathogen: %3$s
Test: %4$s
Test type: %5$s
Test date: %6$s
Test result: %7$s
Test location: %8$s
Manufacturer: %9$s
Tested in: %10$s
Unique certificate identifier: %11$s

Always use the international QR code in other countries. The Dutch QR code is not valid outside the Netherlands.

The following details were retrieved at the test location:Your details: %1$s
Test type: %2$s
Test date: %3$s
Test result: %4$s
Unique certificate identifier: %5$s

The following details were retrieved at the test location:Name: %1$s
Date of birth: %2$s

Test type: %3$s
Test name: %4$s
Test date: %5$s
Test result: %6$s
Test location: %7$s
Test manufacturer: %8$s
Unique certificate identifier: %9$s

The following details of your vaccination were retrieved:

Name: %1$s
Date of birth: %2$s

Pathogen: %3$s
Vaccine: %4$s
Vaccine type: %5$s
Manufacturer: %6$s
Doses: %7$s
Vaccination date: %8$s
Vaccinated in: %9$s
Unique certificate identifier: %10$s
Your %1$s isn\'t valid in the Netherlands. You\'ve only got an international certificate.
Your %1$s isn\'t valid internationally. You\'ve only got a Dutch certificate.

Your test certificate isn\'t valid in the Netherlands. That\'s why only an international certificate was made.

It\'s possible the validity period in the Netherlands (%1$s hours is shorter than the validity period in other countries. Get tested again.

Your vaccination certificate isn\'t valid in the Netherlands. That\'s why only an international certificate was made.

It\'s possible you\'ve only had one injection. Add your second vaccination to get a valid Dutch certificate.

Your test certificate isn\'t valid internationally. That\'s why only a Dutch certificate was made.

It\'s possible your type of test isn\'t accepted abroad. Get tested again.

Your vaccination certificate isn\'t valid internationally. That\'s why only a Dutch certificate was made.

It\'s possible your type of vaccination isn\'t accepted abroad.
At this moment, we can\'t make a certificate from your negative test certificate. This can have various causes. Read more here.
At this moment, we can\'t make a certificate from your vaccination. This can have various causes. Read more here.

There is no available vaccination data. This can have various causes. Look here for more information

Got vaccinated recently? It can take a few hours until your details are available. Try again later.

There is no available data of your test result. This can have various causes. Look here for more information.

Already got a negative test result from the GGD? It can take a few hours until your details are available. Try again later.
For a test certificate, you must take a test first. Does the test prove you don\'t have coronavirus? Then you can make your QR code.
The QR code contains a minimum amount of personal data.
There are currently many visitors on the affiliated partner\'s website. We can\'t fetch your details now. Please try again later.
Something went wrong with the server of your test or injection location. Please try again later.
Contact our helpdesk and give them error code (%1$s) or try again later.
Due to increased traffic or an outage at one of the parties, some details may be missing. Please try again later.
Is your name or date of birth wrong? Or are your vaccination details incorrect? Look here for more information.
The app refreshes your QR code in the background, so your QR code remains valid. You need internet so the app can do this regularly.
Your QR code is not active. Connect to the internet so your QR code will be valid again.

From now on, you can create a certificate of recovery using this app. This is proof you have had a positive test result. You can use it to show you’ve had coronavirus. This way you gain access to certain locations and activities. You may also use it to travel internationally.
Are your details correct? Then you can turn your positive test result into a QR code. This is your certificate.

Have you had coronavirus? Then you can make a recovery certificate of the positive test result from the GGD. Log in with DigiD to retrieve your test result.

Your recovery certificate will be valid 11 days after the positive test result.
At this moment, we can\'t make a certificate from your positive test result. This can have various causes. Read more here.

There is no positive test result available.

Got tested recently? It can take a few hours until your details are available. Try again later.
Positive test result is not valid
Have you been tested more than 180 days ago? Then your test result is no longer valid. In this case, you cannot create a recovery certificate.
The test proves I have coronavirus

The following details were retrieved at the test location:Name: %1$s
Date of birth: %2$s

Test date: %3$s
Valid from: %4$s
Valid until: %5$s
Unique certificate identifier: %6$s
At this moment, we can\'t make a certificate from your positive test result. This can have various causes. Read more here.
Positive test result is not valid
Have you been tested more than 180 days ago? Then your test result is no longer valid. In this case, you cannot create a recovery certificate.

Travelling outside of the Netherlands? Then more data is required. That\'s why the international QR code contains the following details:

Name: %1$s
Date of birth: %2$s

Illness from which recovered: %3$s
Test date: %4$s
Tested in: %5$s
Certificate issuer: %6$s
Valid from: %7$s
Valid until: %8$s
Unique certificate identifier: %9$s
Always use the international QR code in other countries. The Dutch QR code is not valid outside of the Netherlands.

Your recovery certificate isn\'t valid in the Netherlands, because the type of test is not accepted.

You’ve only got an international QR-code.

Your recovery certificate isn\'t valid internationally. You\'ve only got a Dutch certificate.

The reason is that the type of test is not accepted. An international recovery certificate can only be made with a PCR-test.
Your QR code does not work because of a server error. Try again
or call the help desk at 0800-1421 (free)
Connect to the internet to make sure your QR code works again. Try again
Due to a technical error you’ve wrongly received a Dutch vaccination certificate. This was corrected.
Something went wrong while refreshing your details
Please retrieve your details again via the app.

You can add a certificate if you\'re vaccinated, if you\'ve had corona or by taking a test at an affiliated test location. The app generates a certificate for the Netherlands and one for other countries.

Travelling outside the Netherlands?
Check wijsopreis.nl before you leave. There you will find which certificate is valid in the country you’re planning to visit.
